member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.CountChecksumEventHandler
member.summary: GXPacket component calls this method when the checksum is counted.
member.remarks:
If own checksum count is used, the SetChecksumParameters ChkType public must be set to Own. If checksum type is something different than Own, this method is not called.
This event is called first time with empty data to resolve the size of used crc.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.IsReplyPacketEventHandler
member.summary: GXClient component calls this method when it checks if the received packet is a reply packet for the send packet.
member.remarks: GXClient calls this method when it receives a new packet. This method checks if the received packet is the response to the sent packet. The response depends on the used protocol. GXClient goes through all sent packets one by one until isReplyPacket is set to True. If this method is not implemented GXCom assumes that received packet is a reply packet for the first sent packet.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.AcceptNotifyEventHandler
member.summary: GXClient component uses this method to check if received notify message is accepted.
member.remarks: When event message is received this method is used to check is received packet accepted.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.ReceivedEventHandler
member.summary: GXClient component sends all asynchronous and notification packets using this method.
member.remarks: This method handles the received asynchronous and notification packets. If all communication is done using synchronous communication, this method is not necessary to implement.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.ParsePacketFromDataEventHandler
member.summary: GXClient component calls this method, if the client application uses its own parsing method, instead of the one of GXCom.
member.remarks: This method is called only, if ParseReceivedPacket is set True.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.ReceiveDataEventHandler
member.summary: Checks if the received data is from the correct device. If ReceiveData is set to False, received data is ignored.
member.remarks: Use this method to identify the correct data.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.DirtyEventHandler
member.summary: Called, when the client settings or the media settings are modified.

member.summary: Called before packet is send.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.NamespaceDoc
T:Gurux.Communication.GXClient
member.summary: From the point of view of the client software, GXClient is the main component of the Gurux Communication system. A client software can create a media, and change its properties, through the GXClient object. GXClient steps in also, when starting a media, and when sending and receiving packets. Because there can be multiple instances of the GXClient component, the term the GXClient object points to the instance, which makes the call.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.#ctor
member.summary: Create initial sertions after serialize.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels packet sending.

member.summary: Destructor.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.GetAvailableMedias
member.summary: Returns string collection of available media types.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.GetAvailableMedias(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns string collection of available media types.
member.param: If true, returns only connected medias otherwice returns all medias.
member.remarks: Connected parameter is used because there might be that there is example GXSerial dll that can load, but there are no physical serial ports. In this situation serial port is not returned.

member.summary: Add event handler.
member.param: Collection of clients that this handler can handle

member.summary: Remove event handler.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.MediaProperties(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Shows and changes the properties of the active media.
member.remarks: If media settings are changed, MediaOpen must be called. The media must be selected, before this method is called.
member.param: Owner window of the Properties dialog.
member.returns: Returns True if user has accect changes. Otherwice false.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Properties(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shows and changes the properties of the protocol.
member.remarks:
A media must be selected, before using this method.
Note: If media is open, protocol settings cannot be changed.
member.param: If True, media properties are shown.
Owner window of the Properties dialog.
member.returns: Returns True if user has accect changes. Otherwice false.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.SelectMedia(System.String)
member.summary: Selects the Media.
member.remarks: If the selected Media is not installed, an error is returned. Note: Media name is not case sensitive.
member.returns: Returns True if user has accect changes. Otherwice false.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.AssignMedia(Gurux.Common.IGXMedia)
member.summary: Assigns new media, after media settings are changed.
member.remarks: The media must be created before calling this method. See methods EnumMedias and SelectMedia. Active media is implemented with GetCurrentMedia method. AssignMedia closes the active media and selects a new one. The protocol settings do not change, when AssignMedia is called. After AssignMedia is called, the media must be opened with MediaOpen method. The new media is selected with the SelectMedia method.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.CloseServer
member.summary: Closes the connection to the GXCom. The used media is not closed, if there is more than one client that uses GXCom. The media is closed, when the last GXClient closes connection. It is recommended to use Close method, instead of MediaClose.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.CloseMedia
member.summary: Closes the media and resets to initial media settings.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Open
member.summary: Opens the communication.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Send(Gurux.Communication.GXPacket,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends the packet.
member.param: If True, synchronous sending mode is used. If False, asynchronous mode is used.
member.remarks: If GXPacket is sent synchronously, GXCom fills the sent packet with information of the received packet, so data can be used instantly after the Send call. If GXPacket is sent asynchronously, data is received through Received method.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.CreatePacket
member.summary: Creates default packet with client settings.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.ReleasePacket(Gurux.Communication.GXPacket)
member.summary: Releases packet so it can be recycled.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.ReleasePacket(System.Collections.Generic.List{Gurux.Communication.GXPacket})
member.summary: Releases packet so it can be recycled.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Reset
member.summary: Resets sender and receiver buffers.
member.remarks: Call this function if the size of the sender or receiver buffer increases too high. A media must be selected, before using this method.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.GetSettings(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the client settings as an XML string.
member.param: If True, Media settings are included, if any settings exist.
member.returns: Returns client settings, as XML string.

member.summary: Retrieves collection of the other clients, who share the same server.
member.returns: Collection of other GXClients, who share the same server.
member.remarks: The inquiring client itself is left out of the collection that is returned, and only the parallel clients are listed.

member.summary: Close connection to the meter if latest client.

member.summary: Contains data and packet statistics.

member.summary: Gets or sets the BOP (Beginning of the packet), and the BOP type.
member.remarks: A media must be selected, before using this method. If BOP is not used, the type is null. By default variant type of BOP is null.

member.summary: Returns the active media.
member.remarks: Use this method, when current Media properties need to be changed.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Trace
member.summary: Trace level of the GXClient.
member.remarks: Used in System.Diagnostic.Trace.Writes.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.MediaSettings
member.summary: Media settings.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.MediaType
member.summary: Used Media type

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.ID
member.summary: Object Identifier.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.ByteOrder
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the byte order.
member.remarks: Byte order must be set, before new data is inserted into the packet. Both GXPacket and GXClient must use the same byte order. Default byte order is LittleEndian.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.MediaIsOpen
member.summary: Returns True, if the media is currently open.
member.remarks: A media must be selected, before using this method.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.ResendCount
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the resend count of the packet.
member.remarks: ResendCount indicates how many times GXCom tries to resend the packet. GXPacket and GXClient have separate resend count properties. For more information about resend count properties see GXPacket ResendCount. By default, the GXClient ResendCount is used. If the resend count is -3, the transfer protocol (for example TCP/IP) determines the count. If ResendCount of the packet is -2, GXClient ResendCount is used. If it is -1, data is sent, but no reply is expected. If it is 0, data is sent and reply is expected, but packet is not resent, even if there is no answer. If value is more than 0, it determines how many times packet is tried to resend.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.WaitTime
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the waiting time of the packet.
member.remarks: WaitTime indicates, for how long GXCom waits for the reply packet, before trying to resend the packet. The value is given in milliseconds. By default, the WaitTime of GXClient is used. If the wait time is -3, the transfer protocol (for example TCP/IP) determines the time. To use WaitTime of GXClient, set WaitTime of the GXPacket to -2. If set to -1, waiting time is infinite.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.ParseReceivedPacket
member.summary: Retrieves or sets a Boolean to indicate, if the application parses the received packets.
member.remarks: Set this value to True, if the client application handles the parsing. By default, the value is False, meaning that the parsing is done by GXCom. A media must be selected, before using this method.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.Dirty
member.summary: Retrieves or sets, whether the media has been modified, since the last time it was saved.
member.returns: True if the media has been modified, since it was last saved. False, if not modified since last saving.

member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize the connection.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.SyncCommunication
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize the communication with the Media.

member.summary: The owner of the GXClient. Usually a GXDevice.

member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the error event of a Gurux component.

member.summary: Media component sends notification, when its state changes.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnCountChecksum
member.summary: GXPacket component calls this method when the checksum is counted.
member.remarks:
If own checksum count is used, the SetChecksumParameters ChkType public must be set to Own. If checksum type is something different than Own, this method is not called.
This event is called first time with empty data to resolve the size of used crc.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnVerifyPacket
member.summary: Check that received packet is OK.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnIsReplyPacket
member.summary: GXClient component calls this method when it checks if the received packet is a reply packet for the send packet.
member.remarks: GXClient calls this method when it receives a new packet. This method checks if the received packet is the response to the sent packet. The response depends on the used protocol. GXClient goes through all sent packets one by one until isReplyPacket is set to True. If this method is not implemented GXCom assumes that received packet is a reply packet for the first sent packet.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnAcceptNotify
member.summary: GXClient component uses this method to check if received notify message is accepted.
member.remarks: When event message is received this method is used to check is received packet accepted.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnReceived
member.summary: GXClient component sends all asynchronous and notification packets using this method.
member.remarks: This method handles the received asynchronous and notification packets. If all communication is done using synchronous communication, this method is not necessary to implement.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnParsePacketFromData
member.summary: GXClient component calls this method, if the client application uses its own parsing method, instead of the one of GXCom.
member.remarks: This method is called only, if ParseReceivedPacket is set True.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnReceiveData
member.summary: Checks if the received data is from the correct device. If ReceiveData is set to False, received data is ignored.
member.remarks: Use this method to identify the correct data.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnBeforeSend
member.summary: Called before packet is sent.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnLoad
member.summary: Initialize client settings.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.OnUnload
member.summary: Make client cleanup

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.GXClient.GXProxyClass
member.summary: Load medias to own namespace.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser
member.summary: This interface implements GXClient handler interface.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.Load(System.Object)
member.summary: Initialize settings.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.Connect(System.Object)
member.summary: Connect to the meter.
member.remarks: Initialize all packet parset settings here.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.Disconnect(System.Object)
member.summary: Disconnect from the meter.
member.remarks: Make cleanup here.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.BeforeSend(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXPacket)
member.summary: Called before new packet is send to device. If this is not want to read return false. In this function you can add extra data to the packet if needed.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.IsReplyPacket(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXReplyPacketEventArgs)
member.summary: Set GXReplyPacketEventArgs to true if packet is a reply packet.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.AcceptNotify(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXReplyPacketEventArgs)
member.summary: Is device send acceptable reply packet.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.CountChecksum(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXChecksumEventArgs)
member.summary: Count checksum for the packet.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.ReceiveData(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXReceiveDataEventArgs)
member.summary: Initial validation of received data before parsing.
member.remarks: Good place to remove received keepalive messages from data stream.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.VerifyPacket(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXVerifyPacketEventArgs)
member.summary: Verifies received packet.
member.returns: Returns true if packet is OK.
member.remarks: This method is used to test data when automated data parsing is used. Sometimes checksum can match even packet is not compleate. in that case rerurn false and data is try to read again.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.Received(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXReceivedPacketEventArgs)
member.summary: New packet received.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.ParsePacketFromData(System.Object,Gurux.Communication.GXParsePacketEventArgs)
member.summary: Parse new packet from received data.
member.remarks: This method is used only if ParseReceivedPacket is set True in GXScript_Load -function. Return value indigates how many bytes parsed packet is.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.Unload(System.Object)
member.summary: Make cleanup

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXPacketParser.InitializeMedia(System.Object,Gurux.Common.IGXMedia)
member.summary: Initialize default settings for the media.
member.remarks: This is called when new device is created.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.Common.GXConverter
member.summary: Contains various conversion methods.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.Common.GXConverter.GetBytes(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convert value to byte array.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.Common.GXConverter.FromBCD(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts BCD (Binary Coded Desimal) to string.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.Common.GXConverter.ToBCD(System.String)
member.summary: Converts string to BCD (Binary Coded Desimal).

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.Common.GXConverter.ToHex(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts value to hex string.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.Common.GXConverter.FromHex(System.String,System.Type)

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType
member.summary: Available checksum types.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.None
member.summary: Checksum is not computed.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Own
member.summary: Client application provides its own checksums.
member.remarks: CountChecksum method is called.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc16
member.summary: 16-bit algorithm is used to compute the checksum.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc16Reverced
member.summary: Reversed 16-bit algorithm is used to compute the checksum.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc32
member.summary: 32-bit algorithm is used to compute the checksum.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Fletcher
member.summary: Fletchers 16-bit algorithm is used to compute the checksum.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Adler32
member.summary: Adlers 32-bit algorithm is used to compute the checksum.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Ccitt16
member.summary: Expressed as X^16+X^12+X^5+X^0. USed in X.25. Polynomial is 0x1021 and seed is 0xFFFF.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Ibm16
member.summary: Used in modbus. Expressed as X^16+X^15+X^2+X^0.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Ccitt16Reverced
member.summary: Used in XMODEM, Kermit. Expressed as X^16 + X^15 + X^10 + X^3 Polynomial is 0x8408 and seed is 0x0.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Zmodem
member.summary: Used in ZMODEM. Polynomial is 0x1021 and seed is 0x0.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc16Arc
member.summary: Used in ARC, LHA and BISYNCH. Polynomial is 0x8005 and seed is 0x0.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc24
member.summary: Polynomial is 0x1864CFB and seed is 0xB704CE.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc32Reverced
member.summary: Reversed 32 bit byteorder is used.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc8
member.summary: 8 bit CRC. Expressed as X^8+X^5+X^4+X^3+X^0.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc8Reverced
member.summary: CCITT-8 Polynomial. Expressed As: X^8 + X^5 + X^4 + 1. Used in ATM and HEC.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Crc8Xor
member.summary: 8 Bit Bitwise XOR. Seed is 0.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Sum16Bit
member.summary: Adds up the bytes, called also a longitudinal redundancy check (LRC).

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Sum32Bit
member.summary: Adds up the bytes.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Fcs16
member.summary: Count CRC for the FCS16. Expressed as x^16 + x^12 + x^5 + x^0. Polynomial is 0x1021 and seed is 0xFFFF. FinalXOR is 0xFFFF data is reversed and reflection is used.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Custom
member.summary: Custom checksum is used.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.Sum8Bit
member.summary: Adds up the bytes.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ChecksumType.CrcAbbAlpha
member.summary: ABB Alpha's checksum.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.summary: User has reset transaction time so packet is not going old.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXServerSender.GetWaitTime(System.Int32@)
member.summary: How long we wait before trying to send the packet again. If the buffer is empty we wait until a new item is added. If there are items in the buffer wait until first timeout occures.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXServerSender.Run
member.summary: This thread sends packet's data to the media.

member.summary: Add event handler.

member.summary: Remove event handler.

member.summary: GXServer class factory.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXServer.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel all packets.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXServer.Release(Gurux.Communication.GXServer,Gurux.Communication.GXClient)
member.summary: Remove client from the server.

member.summary: Bitmask defining parts of the packet.

member.summary: The data part of the packet.

member.remarks: There is only one instance of event handler.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.IGXEventHandler.ClientConnected(System.String)

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket
member.summary: GXPacket component includes a header, and a data field, of a data packet used in communication. It also includes the methods for modifying those fields. In addition, every packet can be set to have unique settings. For example, a certain single packet can be set to wait a shorter time in sending, than other packets sent by the system. Also, for example, the resend count can vary from packet to another.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.#ctor
member.summary: Packet is created using GXClient's CreatePacket -method.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Copy(Gurux.Communication.GXPacket)
member.summary: Create a copy of the GXPacket.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.AppendData(System.Object)
member.summary: Appends new data to the data part of the packet.
member.remarks: DataType parameter determines the format, in which the data is appended. If the data is given in a hexadecimal string, every byte is separated with a space. Error is returned, if appended data is empty, or in an unknown form.

example.code: 'Append data as number which takes one byte. GXPacket1.Append "10", GX_VT_BYTE 'Append data as string which takes two bytes. (One byte for each char) GXPacket1.Append "10", GX_VT_STR 'Append data as hex string which takes two bytes. GXPacket1.Append "10 00", GX_VT_HEX_STR

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.CountChecksum(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the checksum for the contents of the packet.
member.remarks: The checksum is computed from the data of the GXPacket object. This method should not be called directly. GXClient calls this method automatically, when checksum is computed.
member.param: Position where to start counting CRC.
How many bytes are counted. If all, set to -1.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ShouldSwap
member.summary: Swap bytes if different byte order is used.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ExtractData(System.Type,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts the data of the packet into an object.
member.param: Zero based index, in the data part, where exporting is started.
Determines how many items are exported. Value -1 indicates that all items are copied.
member.remarks: Use this method to export the data part of the packet. If the data is given in a hexadecimal string every byte is separated with a space.
member.returns: Returns an error, if there is not enough data in the data part.

example.code:
'Extract three bytes as byte array. GXPacket1.ExtractData data, GX_VT_BYTE, 0, 3
'Extract all data as hex string. Starting from position 1. GXPacket1.ExtractData data, GX_VT_HEX_STR, 1, -1

member.returns: Object as given type from the byte array.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ExtractPacket
member.summary: Extracts the whole packet as a byte array.
member.remarks: This method returns data that is send to the device.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ToString
member.summary: Dumps the packet to a hex string.
member.remarks: String consists of BOP, header, data, EOP and checksum. Use this method to see what packet looks like in hex string format.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.InsertData(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts new data into the packets data part.
member.returns: Returns an error, if data is empty, or in an unknown form.
member.remarks: If the data is given in a hexadecimal string, every byte is separated with a space.

example.code: 'Add new data to data part. GXPacket1.InsertData "01 02 03 04", GX_VT_HEX_STR, 0

member.param: Position in bytes, in the packet data, where data is inserted.
Index from where the data is added.
How many bytes are added. Set to Zero if all data is added.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.RemoveData(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes bytes from the data part of the packet.
member.param: Position of the first byte to remove.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ClearData
member.summary: Clears the data of the packet.
member.remarks: The data contents of the packet is released, and data size is set to zero.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Clear
member.summary: Resets the packet component.
member.remarks: Clears packet data, and sets all member variables to default values.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ParsePacket(System.Byte[],System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is used to parse packet from given data.
member.param: The data, from which the packet is parsed.
Zero based index of the starting point of packet, in the given data.
Size of the parsed packet, in bytes.

member.name: M:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.GetSize(Gurux.Communication.PacketParts)
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the selected packet parts.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize the connection.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Bop
member.summary: Gets the BOP (Beginning of the packet), and the BOP type.
member.remarks:
By default the BOP type is null, which means that the BOP is not used.
Other supported BOP types are an 8-bit unsigned integer, a 16-bit signed integer and a 32-bit signed integer.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Eop
member.summary: Gets the EOP (End of the packet), and the EOP type.
member.remarks:
By default the EOP type is null, which means that the EOP is not used.
Other supported EOP types are an 8-bit unsigned integer, a 16-bit signed integer and a 32-bit signed integer.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Checksum
member.summary: Counted checksum.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.MinimumSize
member.summary: Minimum size of the data packet.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.SendTime
member.summary: When packet is send for a first time.
member.remarks: GXServer uses this information when it try to send packet again.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.SendCount
member.summary: How many times packet is send to the device.
member.remarks: GXServer uses this information when it try to send packet again.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Id
member.summary: Object Identifier.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ByteOrder
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the used byte order.
member.remarks: Byte order must be set before new data is inserted into the packet. Both GXPacket and GXClient must use the same byte order. Default byte order is LittleEndian.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ReplyDelay
member.summary: Retrieves the delivery time of the packet.
member.remarks: ReplyDelay is used to check how much time it takes for GXCom to send the packet and get reply from the device. This value is used for development purposes. Do not try to set this value. GXClient resets this value every time, when a new packet is sent.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ResendCount
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the resend count of the packet.
member.remarks: ResendCount indicates how many times GXCom has tried to resend the packet. GXPacket and GXClient have separate resend count properties. For more information about resend count properties see GXClient ResendCount. By default GXClient ResendCount is used. If the resend count is -3, the transfer protocol (for example TCP/IP) determines the count. If ResendCount of the Packet is -2, GXClient ResendCount is used. If it is -1, data is sent, but no reply is expected. If it is 0, data is sent and reply is expected, but packet is not resent if there is no answer. If value is more than 0, it determines how many times packet is tried to resend.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.SenderInfo
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the sender information of the packet.
member.remarks:
This value depends on the used media.
In DialUp, the form is "IP Address:Port #" (127.0.0.1:134).
In GPRS media, the form is "IP Address:Port #" (127.0.0.1:134).
In Network media, the form is "IP Address:Port #" (127.0.0.1:134).
In Serial media, the used serial port is saved here.
In SMS media, the phone number of the sender is saved here.
In SNMP, the form is "IP Address:Port #" (127.0.0.1:134).
In Terminal media, this public is not used.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.Status
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the status of the packet.
member.remarks: By default the status of the packet is Ok (GX_STATE_OK). The status of the packet is reset every time GXClient sends the packet.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.WaitTime
member.summary: Retrieves or sets waiting time of the packet.
member.remarks: WaitTime indicates for how int GXCom waits for the reply packet before trying to resend the packet. The value is given in milliseconds. By default, the WaitTime of GXClient is used. If the wait time is -3, the transfer protocol (for example TCP/IP) determines the time. To use WaitTime of GXClient, set WaitTime of the GXPacket to -2. If set to -1, waiting time is infinite.

member.name: P:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.ChecksumSettings
member.summary: Checksum parameters.

member.name: E:Gurux.Communication.GXPacket.OnCountChecksum
member.summary: GXPacket component calls this method when the checksum is counted.

member.name: T:Gurux.Communication.ByteOrder
member.summary: User byte orders.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ByteOrder.LittleEndian
member.summary: Little-Endian Byte Order (Intel Byte Order).
member.remarks: The most significant byte is on the right end of the word.

member.name: F:Gurux.Communication.ByteOrder.BigEndian
member.summary: Big-Endian Byte Order (Motorola Byte Order).
member.remarks: The most significant byte is on the left end of the word.
